title: Brenig Way Walking Route

images.title: Pont Corwen by Oliver Dixon, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Pont Corwen. This riverside town marks the start point for the walk.

images.caption: Pont Dyfrdwy, Cynwyd. Four arched bridge over the river Dee at Cynwyd, near Corwen.

images.title: Dot Potter / Forestry and Llyn Brenig
images.caption: Forestry and Llyn Brenig. Forestry commission land and Llyn Brenig taken from near Bryn y Gors Goch.

description: Follow the Brenig Way way from Corwen , in the Dee Valley , to the beautiful Llyn Brenig , in the heart of the Denbigh Moors. The walk passes through Cynwyd, Maerdy and Betws Gwerfil Goch, before following the River Clwyd towards Clocaenog Forest where there are fabulous views of the Clwydian Range AONB. At Cyffylliog you then join the River Clywedog leading you to Llyn Brenig where you follow the shoreline to the finish point at the visitor centre. The final section has fabulous views of Snowdonia and also crosses the Brenig dam.
